com.yantra.api.wms.pickplanning

Interface manageWave

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.WMSApi, YIFApi

    public interface manageWave

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document manageWave(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The manageWave API can create a wave, modify its attributes, and cancel a wave.

    • Method Detail

      • manageWave

        org.w3c.dom.Document manageWave(YFSEnvironment env,
                                org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                         throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                java.rmi.RemoteException

        The manageWave API can create a wave, modify its attributes, and cancel a wave.

        This includes the ability to:

        • Create a Wave.
        • Add Shipment Lines belonging to a specified Shipment to a Wave.
        • Remove Shipments based on a ProfileID from a Wave.
        • Remove Shipment Lines belonging to a specified Shipment from a Wave.
        • Modify other attributes of Wave like ReleaseNoLaterThan, ReleaseNoEarlierThan, ShipmentGroupId. ShipmentGroupId can be modified if wave is either in CREATED or in ACCEPTED status.
        • Cancel a Wave. All Shipment Lines in the Wave are removed and WaveNo is blanked out. Depending on the number of tasks, wave cancellation happens either in online mode or offline mode. The mode of operation is dependent on the property 'yfs.cancelwave.offline.taskcount.greaterthan' exposed in yfs.properties file. When wave is to be cancelled in offline mode, the background status of the wave is updated to 00 (Cancellation Requested). In case of offline mode, if by chance any task cannot be cancelled, then wave background status gets updated to 01 (Cancellation Failed).

        This can take input in two flavours:

        • ShipmentList:If wave creation/modification is desired based on a list of shipments
        • ShipmentCriteria:If wave creation/modification is desired based on shipments that staisfy a particular criteria
        Hence either ShipmentList or ShipmentCriteria is mandatory

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        Depending on modifications taking place, the manageWave may call certain user exits.
        When a wave is created (Action is CREATE) API may invoke following user exits:


          com.yantra.wms.japi.ue.WMSBeforeCreateWaveUE

        Events Raised: These events are raised under base transaction CREATE_WAVE when a wave is created, otherwise under base transaction MANAGE_WAVE, except when the wave is cancelled. When a wave is cancelled, event is raised under the base transaction CANCEL_WAVE.

        ON_SUCCESS:

          This event is raised upon successful execution of manageWave.
          Data published - WMS_MANAGE_WAVE.ON_SUCCESS.xml
          Key data - wave_dbd.txt

        WAVE_CANCELLATION_REQUESTED:

          This event is raised upon successful execution of manageWave for action 'Cancel'.
          Data published - WMS_MANAGE_WAVE.ON_SUCCESS.xml
          Key data - wave_dbd.txt

        WAVE_CANCELLATION_FAILED:

          This event is raised upon failure of offlince cancellation of wave.
          Data published - WMS_MANAGE_WAVE.ON_SUCCESS.xml
          Key data - wave_dbd.txt

        Template Support: Yes

        Configuration Required for backward compatibility: No

      Audits: None

      Pre-conditions: None

      Post-conditions: None

      Output Template Support: Yes

      Database Extensibility Support: No

      Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

Parameters:
env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

Returns:
An XML document that contains wave details. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
Throws:
com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
